sentence.Network_en: The animals live in matriarchal groups.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些动物按母系群体生活。

sentence.Network_en: The finds from these burial grounds point to the existence of a prosperous matriarchal society.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些墓地中发现的东西说明曾经有过一个昌盛的母系社会.

sentence.Network_en: He was raised in a matriarchal family and was always closer to his mother than his father.
sentence.Network_cn: 他从小生长在一个由女性掌权的家庭，比起和父亲的关系来，他总是跟母亲更亲。

entry.tran: （社会、家族或体系）母系的,母权的
entry.def: A matriarchal society, family, or system is one in which the rulers are female and power or property is passed from mother to daughter.

example.ex: ...the 3,000 years of the matriarchal Sumerian society.
example.tran: 苏美尔人3000年的母系社会历史

entry.tran: （家庭或群体）女性统治的，以女性为中心的
entry.def: A matriarchal family or group is one in which women are more powerful or important than  men.

example.ex: He was raised in a matriarchal family and was always closer to his mother than his father.
example.tran: 他从小生长在一个由女性掌权的家庭，比起和父亲的关系来，他总是跟母亲更亲。

entry.def: If you describe a woman as matriarchal, you mean that she has authority and power within her family or group.
